email.subject: [Call for Papers] MLOps25 - Workshop on Machine Learning Operations

body.introduction: In recent years, the widespread integration of machine learning and deep learning models into real-world applications across various domains has exposed numerous operational challenges in model building, deployment, monitoring, and maintenance. Machine Learning Operations (MLOps) has emerged as a key approach to addressing these challenges. It encompasses practices and tools designed to streamline the entire ML lifecycle, with a focus on end-to-end automation, reproducibility, and scalability of ML workflows.
body.goals: This workshop encourages discussions on bridging the gap between data science experimentation and the reliable operation of ML components in production. We invite submissions that address the open challenges, latest breakthroughs, and practical use cases in the rapidly evolving field of MLOps. By bringing together researchers and practitioners, the workshop aims to foster the exchange of valuable insights and advancements from both academia and industry.
topics_of_interest: Practices to ensure ML model reproducibility, traceability, and explainability
Continuous integration/continuous delivery (CI/CD) practices for ML models
Application of MLOps principles to large language models (LLMOps)
Experience reports on real-world MLOps applications
Challenges in applying MLOps to specific domains (e.g., healthcare and finance)
Collaboration and team dynamics in MLOps
Regulatory and policy aspects of MLOps
Security and data privacy in MLOps

publication.accepted_papers: Accepted papers will be published in the CEUR Workshop Proceedings (CEUR-WS.org).
publication.extended_version: Additionally, authors of accepted papers will be invited to submit an extended version of their work for consideration in the 'Special Issue on MLOps Advancements: Improving Development, Management, and Interpretability in AI and Machine Learning' in the journal Future Generation Computer Systems (FGCS), ranked Q1 in the Scimago Journal Rank (SJR).

types_of_submissions.description: Original research contributions advancing the state-of-the-art in MLOps.
Reports on practical applications, lessons learned, and case studies related to MLOps implementation in real-world scenarios.

submission_guidelines.originality_requirement: Submitted work must be original, previously unpublished, and not under consideration or review by any other publication venue.

body.formatting_instructions: Submissions must follow the CEURART style required by CEUR Workshop Proceedings. Authors can use the LaTeX, Word (DOCX), or LibreOffice (ODT) templates available here. An Overleaf template is also available here. Please use the 1-column style version and ensure the use of the Libertinus font as specified in the templates. All submissions must be double-blind (authors' names must be omitted from the submission) and uploaded via the EasyChair submission site. Each manuscript will receive at least two evaluations from the program committee.
body.closing: We look forward to your contributions and to the stimulating discussions on MLOps that will unfold at the workshop!
